channel.title: denvaar's site
channel.description: denvaar's personal site. Most of the content is on software development and computer programming. However, other one-off topics are in the mix.

item.title: A Philosophy of Software Design Book Review
item.description: My review of A Philosophy of Software Design by John Ousterhout

item.title: The Holdovers
item.description: My summary / review / thoughts about the 2023 film, The Holdovers. Directed by Alexander Payne and written by David Hemingson.

item.title: Web App Development Retrospective
item.description: I developed a web app for my wife's landscape design business. It's been in use for a couple of years now. This is a summary of the technology, and some of the challenges I faced.

item.title: 365 Walks In 2023
item.description: Walking goal completed.

item.title: Population Count Pattern
item.description: Understanding why a concise, macro-defined array can be used as a lookup table for finding the number of set bits in a number.

item.title: Do a High Five as You Ride Past
item.description: How and why to go for the classic, but rare high five as you ride past.

item.title: Jacobson's Rank
item.description: Rank is a fundamental operation for Succinct Data Structures. It counts the number of set bits up to a given index in a bit array. How can this be done in constant time and sub-linear space?

item.title: Joe Pera "Car Guy"
item.description: Spoilers warning. What's the significance (if any) of the "Car Guy" interaction in S3:E1?

item.title: Everything Everywhere All at Once
item.description: Review of the 2022 movie "Everything Everywhere All at Once". Directed by Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert. Starring Michelle Yeoh, Stephanie Hsu, Ke Huy Quan, and Jamie Lee Curtis.

item.title: Jonathan Goes Country
item.description: Review of Jonathan Richman's 1990 album, "Jonathan Goes Country".

item.title: S'gaw Karen Language Overview
item.description: Karen is an under-documented language. This is a high-level overview of some of the charicteristics and attributes of the language.

item.title: How to Review Code Well
item.description: Plain and simple things for team members to follow when reviewing each other's code.

item.title: Notes from "Extreme Programming Explained"
item.description: Summarized chapters and sections from my reading of Kent Beck's "Extreme Programming Explained". Sentiments from one and two-star Amazon reviews of the book. Some of my thoughts about XP as well.

item.title: Building a Multiplayer Board Game
item.description: I programmed a web application rendition of a board game called Sternhalma.

item.title: Problem Solving
item.description: Going meta - Working through a programming problem to understand problem solving techniques.

item.title: Close Look at CSRF Tokens
item.description: Cross-site request foregery is one of many techniqu es an attacker might use to pwn a web application. In this article we take a close look at how exactly CSRF tokens work from the conte xt of the Phoenix Web Framework.

item.title: Hacktoberfest 2019 Recap
item.description: A recap of the hack nights that Underbelly held for Hacktoberfest 2019: a global, month-long hackathon.

item.title: Content Negotiation & Phoenix
item.description: A quick demo exploring how HTTP content negotiation works with Phoenix.

item.title: Base64 Basics
item.description: Base64 is an encoding scheme used to change binary data into text.

item.title: Unexpected Benefits From Shrinking My Pull Requests
item.description: Small pull requests help improve the code review process, but making it a priority has helped me improve in several ot her ways.

item.title: Planning
item.description: I have a lot of things that I want to learn and build. I've found that planning and organizing puts me in a better position to take my goals from start to finish.

item.title: My Favorite Things From ElixirConf
item.description: I had the chance to attend LoneStar ElixirConf 2018 - a programming conference in Austin, Texas. I sat in a conference room for two days and listened to people talk. ðŸŽ¶ These are a few of my favorite things. ðŸŽ¶

item.title: Exploring Text Compression
item.description: Challenges, takeaways, and findings of coding up a famous text compression algorithm.

item.title: Makeshift Security Camera
item.description: Fun project using the Raspberry Pi camera module to catch creeps, thieves, and what-have-you.

item.title: On Learning Elixir
item.description: Exploring a different way of approaching and solving problems with the cool functional language of Elixir.

item.title: Diffie-Hellman Key Exchange
item.description: An explanation of an important public key cryptography algorithm as well as some of the history behind it.

item.title: More Binary Tree Properties
item.description: Height and depth of a tree and determining if it's balanced.

item.title: Binary Search Tree
item.description: Review of the basic data structure Binary Search Tree (BST)

item.title: Binary Tree Traversal
item.description: Overview of Breadth and Depth first traversal in a Binary Tree.

item.title: Open Financial Exchange (OFX)
item.description: Some information about using OFX for obtaining financial data.

item.title: Strategy Design Pattern
item.description: Quick example of the Strategy pattern in Python.

item.title: Template Method Design Pattern
item.description: Example of the Template Method design pattern with Python.

item.title: Gathering Time Series Data
item.description: A brief description of an efficient solution to gather new time series data.

item.title: Python Code Optimization Tips
item.description: Tips from Guido Van Rossum about code optimization.

item.title: Optimization with Timeit
item.description: Code optimization analysis using Python's timeit module.
